Context/Sentence: A decoration. "That ornament has been in the family since 1974."
A region/sea. "I wish this holiday party was taking place in the Caribbean."
An ancient Egyptian ruler. "He dressed up as a pharaoh for the 'Holiday History' party."
A parasitic plant used for kissing. "Stand under the mistletoe at your own risk."
Something that happens. "Uncle Bob falling into the tree is an annual occurrence."
A prehistoric flying reptile. "Why is there a pterodactyl on top of the tree?"
A dark shape against light. "I saw the silhouette of Santa on the roof."
(Or Manoeuvre) A skillful movement. "It took a clever manoeuvre to fit the ham in the oven."
Wishing to do what is right. "Be conscientious about how much eggnog you drink."
Characterized by middle-class materialistic values. "This artisanal cheese is very bourgeois."
A breed of dog. "The dachshund is wearing a very small sweater."
A word that mimics a sound. "'Sizzle' is an onomatopoeia for the latkes frying."
A person who acts as a link. "The toddler acted as a liaison between us and the cookies."
Characterized by long words. "This spelling bee is for the sesquipedalian guests."
